main event: On 10 November 1948, three luminous flying objects were observed over Boston, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The objects were described as three fast-flying, single-engine planes flying over the Charles River., The observer noted that the planes had no lights and appeared visible only due to city lights., The middle plane was reported to weave back and forth while the outside planes flew straight., The estimated altitude of the objects was about 2000 feet., Despite being visible and close, the observer reported they made no sound.
witness description: Mr. [REDACTED], a retired organizer, described as of average intelligence. He has previously been involved in various social organizations.
